alert.note: Alert for Pulaski (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 09 at 1:41AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Pulaski and southwestern Rockcastle Counties through 215 AM EDT... At 141 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Bandy, or 10 miles southwest of Mount Vernon, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Willailla and Quail around 145 AM EDT. Level Green, Bromo, Spiro and Maretburg around 150 AM EDT. Wabp, Valley Oak and Shopville around 155 AM EDT. Hansford, Sand Springs and Wellhope around 200 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Bloss, Pongo and Sand Hill. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 54 and 59. Kentucky Highway 80 in Pulaski County between mile markers 28 and 37. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
